result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie Zarena Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 12 days, only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any business that sells alcohol except to pay for necessities (gas, groceries).

No unsupervised contact with any unrelated minors except for employment purposes.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1, except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie Zarena Hill

defendant.name: Hill, Carrie Zarena
defendant.address: P.O. Box 132, 4535 N Branch St, Wabeno, WI 54566

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Called at 2:41 PM. Also called 14CF140. Carrie Hill appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - on 14CF140 - DRI only count, 14CF110 - has complied with victim notification requirements with no response - count #1 - amend to 948.09 (sexual intercourse with child 16 or over), count #2 - amend to obstructing contrary to 946.41;  #1 - G plea as amended, #2 - g/nc as amended, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service on count #1, court costs only on each count, part time employment for stated reasons, no unsupervised contact with any unrelated minors except for employment purposes. Hill agrees. Court - 14CF110 - amends count #1 to sexual intercourse with a child over the age of 16 contrary to 948.09 - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G. Court - 14CF110 - amend #2 to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41 - reads new charge and penalty, pleads NC. Court dismisses only count on 14CF140. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation - not asking for sexual registry for stated reasons. Burns - follow joint recommendation. Hill makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service on count #1, court costs only on each count (including DNA surcharge) - paid thru probation, part time employment for stated reasons, no unsupervised contact with any unrelated minors except for employment purposes, credit for 12 days only if revoked (stipulated), right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 3:37 PM. Carrie Hill appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by  Charles Simono. State calls Deputy William Hujet. Hujet sworn in at 3:37 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (3:43 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 3:45 PM. Hujet excused at 3:45 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 10/22/14 at 1:30 PM.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy WH

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:56 AM. Carrie Hill appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint, waives reading, requests PH, waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 9/17/14 at 3:00 PM.
No contact with victim (B.P.) or any child under the age of 18 but is allowed contact thru her employment but must be supervised at all times in regards to that.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim B.L.P., no contact with any person under the age of 18
